meanings.definition: A follower or underling of a powerful person.
meanings.sent1: The evil villain's minions carried out his every command.
meanings.sent2: The minions of the king were always by his side.
meanings.sent3: The minions scurried around, trying to please their boss.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a minion in the corporate world, always following orders.
meanings.sent5: The minions in the movie were portrayed as bumbling sidekicks.

meanings.sent1: He was treated like a minion by his arrogant boss.
meanings.sent2: The rich lady dismissed the waiter as a mere minion.
meanings.sent3: The minion sighed as he realized his lowly position.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a minion in the grand scheme of things.
meanings.sent5: The minion's role was to simply follow orders without question.

meanings.definition: A group of loyal followers or supporters.
meanings.sent1: The political leader had a loyal group of minions who always backed him.
meanings.sent2: The team's minions cheered enthusiastically from the sidelines.
meanings.sent3: The minions stood united behind their leader, ready to defend him.
meanings.sent4: The minions formed a strong bond of loyalty with each other.
meanings.sent5: The minions' unwavering support was crucial for the success of the cause.
